title: 114_hr2595
content: The Act is titled the "Save Our National Parks Transportation Act." It establishes the Nationally Significant Federal Lands and Tribal Projects Program. The "Save Our National Parks Transportation Act" establishes the Nationally Significant Federal Lands and Tribal Projects Program under Chapter 2 of title 23, United States Code. This program aims to provide funding for the construction, reconstruction, or rehabilitation of nationally significant Federal lands and tribal transportation projects. Eligibility for funding includes entities eligible under sections 201, 202, 203, and 204 of this title, with a special rule allowing State, county, or local governments sponsored by eligible Federal land management agencies or Indian tribes to also receive funds. The "Save Our National Parks Transportation Act" establishes the Nationally Significant Federal Lands and Tribal Projects Program under Chapter 2 of title 23, United States Code. Eligible entities sponsored by eligible Federal land management agencies or Indian tribes can apply for funds by submitting an application to the Secretary. Projects must be on Federal lands transportation facilities, Federal lands access transportation facilities, or tribal transportation facilities, and demonstrate completion of activities required under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969. The "Save Our National Parks Transportation Act" establishes the Nationally Significant Federal Lands and Tribal Projects Program under Chapter 2 of title 23, United States Code. Eligible entities can apply for funds by submitting an application to the Secretary. Projects must be on Federal lands transportation facilities, Federal lands access transportation facilities, or tribal transportation facilities, and demonstrate completion of activities required under the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969. Projects must have an estimated cost exceeding $25,000,000, with priority given to those exceeding $50,000,000. Funds can only be used for construction, reconstruction, and rehabilitation activities. Selection criteria include furthering goals of the Department of Transportation. The "Save Our National Parks Transportation Act" establishes the Nationally Significant Federal Lands and Tribal Projects Program under Chapter 2 of title 23, United States Code. Eligible projects must further goals of the Department of Transportation, improve critical transportation facilities, require construction, reconstruction, or rehabilitation, be included in the National Register of Historic Places, enhance environmental ecosystems, use new technologies, be supported by funds other than those received under this title, span 2 or more States, and serve lands owned by multiple Federal agencies or Indian tribes. The "Save Our National Parks Transportation Act" establishes the Nationally Significant Federal Lands and Tribal Projects Program under Chapter 2 of title 23, United States Code. This program allows for the Federal share of project costs for nationally significant projects on Federal lands and tribal areas. Amendments are made to Section 201(b) to include the nationally significant Federal lands and tribal projects program in the Federal lands transportation program. Amendments are made to Section 201(c)(3) to include the "nationally significant Federal lands and tribal projects program" in the planning process. "Amendments authorize appropriations for the nationally significant Federal lands and tribal projects program." Authorized appropriations from the Highway Trust Fund for the Nationally significant Federal lands and tribal projects program and the Federal lands transportation program for fiscal years 2016 through 2021. Funds authorized by the United States Fish and Wildlife Service shall be available on October 1 of the fiscal year for which they are authorized, subject to any obligation limitation on Federal-aid highways and highway safety construction programs.
